t.x: Expressing music with one's voice. Or a musical work sung in such manner.
e: I listen to song.
I like song.
Song is an important element in music.
Theoretical understanding of song adds depth to music appreciation.

t.x: A person whose profession is singing. A vocalist, artist.
e: I listen to singer / artist.
I like singer / artist.
Singer / Artist is an important element in music.
Theoretical understanding of singer / artist adds depth to music appreciation.

t.x: A tool for playing music. Piano, guitar, violin, etc.
e: I listen to musical instrument.
I like musical instrument.
Musical Instrument is an important element in music.
Theoretical understanding of musical instrument adds depth to music appreciation.

t.x: An instrument that produces sound by pressing keys. Widely used in classical and popular music.
e: I listen to piano.
I like piano.
Piano is an important element in music.
Theoretical understanding of piano adds depth to music appreciation.

t.x: A string instrument that produces sound by plucking strings. Acoustic and electric guitars exist.
e: I listen to guitar.
I like guitar.
Guitar is an important element in music.
Theoretical understanding of guitar adds depth to music appreciation.

t.x: A percussion instrument played by hitting with hands or sticks. Provides rhythm in a band.
e: I listen to drums.
I like drums.
Drums is an important element in music.
Theoretical understanding of drums adds depth to music appreciation.

t.x: A performance where singers or bands perform in front of an audience. A musical event.
e: I listen to concert.
I like concert.
Concert is an important element in music.
Theoretical understanding of concert adds depth to music appreciation.

t.x: The beat and tempo of music. A regularly repeating pattern of sound.
e: I listen to rhythm.
I like rhythm.
Rhythm is an important element in music.
Theoretical understanding of rhythm adds depth to music appreciation.

t.x: The main musical line of a song. The theme of a piece that can be hummed.
e: I listen to melody.
I like melody.
Melody is an important element in music.
Theoretical understanding of melody adds depth to music appreciation.

t.x: Korean popular music. K-pop. Very popular worldwide.
e: I listen to k-pop.
I like k-pop.
K-pop is an important element in music.
Theoretical understanding of k-pop adds depth to music appreciation.
